summary: This document outlines the terms of a plea agreement for Jeffrey Epstein, requiring him to plead guilty to one count of solicitation of prostitution and one count of solicitation of minors to engage in prostitution. The agreement specifies a 30-month sentence structure involving jail time and community control, and includes provisions regarding gain time.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual entering into the plea agreement, pleading guilty to charges of solicitation of prostitution and solicitation of minors to engage in prostitution.

events.title: Epstein Plea Agreement
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein agrees to plead guilty to charges of solicitation of prostitution and solicitation of minors to engage in prostitution, with a binding recommendation for a 30-month sentence.

locations: 15th Judicial Circuit in and for Palm Beach County
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein agreed to plead guilty to one count of solicitation of prostitution and one count of solicitation of minors to engage in prostitution.
The plea agreement included a binding recommendation for a 30-month sentence, split into 18 months in county jail and 12 months of community control.
The agreement required Epstein to register as a sex offender.
Epstein agreed not to receive any special benefits regarding gain time during incarceration and to provide an accounting of earned gain time upon request.
